worldview_intro.title: Introduction to Worldview
worldview_intro.description: Discover and learn how to use Worldview's tools and features!

steps.content: To start, let's explore the Layers, Events and Data tabs.

steps.title: Layer List
steps.content: The Layer List shows all the imagery layers that are loaded on the map. Base layers under the overlays and only the top most activated base layer will display.

steps.title: Events
steps.content: Select the Events tab to view a curated list of current natural events around the world.

steps.title: Data Download
steps.content: Select the Data tab to download the underlying data for the imagery layers displayed on the map. Once you have selected your desired layer it will direct you to Earthdata Search to download the data.

steps.title: Timeline
steps.content: The Timeline allows you to choose the date of observation and much more!

steps.title: Date Selector
steps.content: Change the date (and time if you have Geostationary layers loaded) by selecting and typing into the date fields, clicking on the up and down arrows by each field.

steps.title: Interval Selector
steps.content: Select the timeline interval you are interested in, or set your own.
Use the back and forward arrows to step backward or forward in time according to the selected interval.

steps.title: Timeline Animation
steps.content: Animate the imagery by clicking on the video camera icon. Click on Play in the animation box to watch the imagery change day by day. You can even  export it as an animated GIF.

steps.title: Timeline Layer Coverage
steps.content: Click here to open the timeline layer coverage panel. Temporal availability of active time-varying layers are shown as a set of striped horizontal blue lines in the panel. The total temporal coverage of the layers is shown on the far right.

steps.title: Timescale Zoom
steps.content: Adjust the timeline view to view the timescale in years, months, and days (And, hours and minutes if you have a Geostationary layer loaded).
Use Location Search by entering a place name or coordinates to place a map marker on the map. Conversely, place a map marker on the map to find out the place name and coordinates
Save the URL of the current state of the website and share it with your friends!
The "Globe" icon allows you to change the projection from Geographic to Arctic or Antarctic.
The "Camera" icon allows you to take a snapshot of the imagery show on the map.

Here you may provide feedback, initiate tour stories, access Worldview's source code, find out what we've been working on recently with "What's new", read notifications, find background information, and access Distraction Free mode. It which removes all of the unnecessary elements so you can focus solely on the map.
Use these to zoom in and out of the map. Alternatively, use your mouse scroll wheel or trackpad.
Measure Distance and Area in kilometers (km) or miles (mi) and export as GeoJSON.

When outside of the tour mode, you can hover the cursor on the map to see the map coordinates here. Click on the coordinates to change map coordinates between Degrees Minutes Seconds, Decimal Degrees, and Degrees Decimal Minutes

steps.title: Layer Picker
steps.content: The Layer Picker allows you to browse and search for imagery layers. Click "+Add Layers" to learn more!

steps.title: Layer Browsing
steps.content: Here you can discover and add relevant layers sorted by Hazards and Disasters categories, by Science Discipline, or by Featured, which include new and noteworthy imagery layers. The most recent layers you've added will show in the "Recent" tab making it easier to find your favorites on return vists.

steps.title: Layer Search
steps.content: The Search bar allows free text searching for layers. Try searching for "cloud".

steps.title: Faceted Filtering
steps.content: You can use the facets to further refine your results.

steps.title: Search Results
steps.content: Click on a search result entry to see the details for the layer. You can also click the checkbox to add a layer to the map.

steps.title: Layer Details
steps.content: Information about the layer including temporal coverage, a description of the imagery layer and reference links can be seen here.  You can also click on "+ Add Layer" to add or "+ Remove Layer" remove a layer from the map.
Click on "Start Comparison" to compare imagery layers!
The Layer List and the screen has now split into two sides, the A and B sides.
